metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4678 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The safe_eval function in Ansible before 1.6.4 does not properly restrict the code subset, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted instructions. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2014-4657. It was discovered that Ansible mishandled certain input. A remote attacker could use this to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4678` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 1.5.4+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
ansible-fireball - 1.5.4+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
ansible-node-fireball - 1.5.4+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: seth-arnold> This CVE was the result of an incomplete fix for CVE-2014-4657

criterions.comment: ansible package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.4+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm2').
